test_questions.question: An aeroplane covers a certain distance at a speed of 240 kmph in 5 hours. To cover the same distance in 1 hours, it must travel at a speed of:
test_questions.explanation:
Distance = (240 x 5) = 1200 km.
Speed = Distance/Time
Speed = 1200/(5/3) km/hr.     [We can write 1 hours as 5/3 hours]



 Required speed =

1200 x
3
km/hr
= 720 km/hr.


5

=
x + 20

 14x = 10x + 200
 4x = 200
 x = 50 km.

 x = 1 hr.      [neglecting the -ve value of x]

test_questions.question: A farmer travelled a distance of 61 km in 9 hours. He travelled partly on foot @ 4 km/hr and partly on bicycle @ 9 km/hr. The distance travelled on foot is:
test_questions.explanation:
Let the distance travelled on foot be x km.
Then, distance travelled on bicycle = (61 -x) km.



So,
x
+
(61 -x)
= 9


4
9



 9x + 4(61 -x) = 9 x 36
 5x = 80
 x = 16 km.
